July 18, 1968
Dr* Kenneth Jones
Director
Telecommunication and Film
San Diego State University
San Diego, California 92155
Dear Dr. Jones:
In recent discussions with Art Hungerford, he has
outlined your proposed plans to establish a '*ghetto”
educational radio station in San Diego, programming
by, for, and about the disadvantaged. I understand
that in conjunction with this project you are plan¬
ning an extensive trip to various areas in the United
States which are now or may be In the future under¬
taking similar activities and uses of educational
radio* With this in mind. Art has requested that I
send you any information HER has available at the
present time about educational radio stations that
have or arf planning specific action programs in
this important area.
I am aware of only one educational radio station,
station WBFO, Buffalo, Hew York, that has plans on
the drawing board to establish a "ghetto” station
similar to that which you are planning In San Diego.
Bill Siemering, Manager of W8F0, The State University
of Hew York, Buffalo, has submitted a proposal to
The Ford Foundation for a grant to develop an edu¬
cational radio outlet for the disadvantaged in the
Buffalo lnnercity. It would seem that Bill would be
an excellent contact for you.
I understand that the Dade County School District in
Miami, Florida, is also doing some excellent program¬
ming for the disadvantaged on their local FM radio
station, WTH5-FM. This station is widely listened
to, and from all reports is doing a very effective
programming job. The coordinator for the program is
Miss Bea Baxter.
